title: Blytheville murder suspect identified, considered 'armed and dangerous'
content:
BLYTHEVILLE, AR (WMC) -
Blytheville police identified the man they said killed a 19-year-old during a feud.
It happened at around 11 p.m. in Blytheville, Arkansas, on August 8.
Investigators said a total of 12 people were shot in the fight, with Adeline King dying from her injuries.
Witnesses said she became the focus of the violence when she said hello to her sister's ex-boyfriend.
Ten of the shooting victims were treated and released from the hospital. One is still in the hospital, and her condition is unknown.
Blytheville police identified Billy Dee Williams, 27, as the man who shot and killed King. They said he is considered armed and dangerous.
Anyone who knows anything about his whereabouts is asked to contact Blytheville Police Department.
